name: Castle Brackenwold
tagline: The fortified castle and keep of the dukes of Brackenwold sit proudly atop a tall hill, with a city stretched at their feet
description: Located four miles from the eaves of Dolmenwood, the fortified castle and keep of the dukes of Brackenwold sit proudly atop a tall hill, with a city stretched at their feet. While the name Castle Brackenwold properly refers only to the castle itself, the surrounding city is commonly included in the designation.
atmosphere: A bustling metropolis that seems a world apart from the rustic ways of Dolmenwood
inhabitants_description: As is the way in all large settlements, folk of all kinds live in Castle Brackenwold. The total population is just under 9,000 souls, principally humans native to the city, but with a sizeable number of immigrants from elsewhere in the Duchy and beyond. Approximately 1,000 people dwell within the walled Inner City.

governance.ruling_body: The Duke of Brackenwold himself directly rules over Castle Brackenwold

religion.religious_practices: Castle Brackenwold is the seat of the Pluritine Church in the Dolmenwood region. Even in the bustling metropolis, however, seemingly a world apart from the rustic ways of Dolmenwood, remnants of ancient Gwyrae worship can be spotted.

history: Castle Brackenwold is an ancient place whose oldest parts were built by elf lords in days of yore, long before the people of Brackenwold migrated to Dolmenwood
This fact has blurred into legends hinting at the fairy blood of the noble line of Brackenwold
A pact was made in the unknown past, compelling each duke of the line of Brackenwold to sacrifice his first born daughter to the entity in the oubliette
current_events: The duke hosts a great tourney at midsummer each year
The ladies of the Brackenwold line have a propensity toward witchcraft and are allied with the witches
rumors_reference: See Rumours in Castle Brackenwold, p443

special_features.name: The Lost Wing
special_features.description: A lost suite of rooms, visible from the outside but which no internal doors or stairways reach. Impetuous young nobles of each generation attempt to gain entrance to the lost rooms, but invariably meet an unpleasant and mysterious doom.

special_features.name: The Oubliette
special_features.description: A secret place in the dungeons of the keep where an ancient evil lurks, chained within the form of a stone throne atop a great pedestal.

special_features.name: The Witches' Library
special_features.description: Secret passages lead to an occult library in the dusty attics of a little-used tower, where the ladies of the Brackenwold line practice witchcraft.

equipment_availability.notes: In addition to the standard equipment and services listed in the DPB, unusual, non-standard businesses can be located with a little investigative work.

locations.name: The Ducal Keep
locations.description: A lofty, white stone keep with numerous towers, turrets, minarets. The ducal keep is the ancestral home to the nobility of the Brackenwold line.
locations.interior: Exorbitant luxury. A seemingly endless procession of hallways, studies, drawing rooms, dining halls, and suites. Luxurious carpets, gold-leafed doorways, exquisite cabinetry, artisan wallpapers painted with scenes from fable and history.
locations.exterior: A lofty, white stone keep with numerous towers, turrets, minarets
locations.populace: The Duke of Brackenwold, the Duchess of Brackenwold, their unmarried daughter (Zoemina—a dashing and highly eligible young woman of 22), their youngest son (Edmund—a callow lad of 14), the Dowager Duchess (the duke's elderly mother—decrepit, dithering, and highly demanding), a continually shifting entourage of noble visitors, and nigh on a hundred servants
secrets: A pact compelling each duke to sacrifice his first born daughter to the entity in the oubliette

locations.name: Bishop's Palace
locations.description: An imposing, church-like building of black stone. The administrative locus of the Church within the Duchy of Brackenwold and home of the bishop.
locations.interior: Cathedralesque vaulted halls, sombre reading rooms, plush studies, and opulent appointment chambers.
locations.exterior: An imposing, church-like building of black stone
locations.populace: The Bishop of Brackenwold, several dozen assistants and librarians, several dozen servants, and a varying number of visiting Church dignitaries
special_features: The Stellarium and the Night Tower

locations.name: Seminary of the 100 Martyrs
locations.description: A 4-storeyed edifice decorated with grimacing gargoyles of dark stone. Priests of the Pluritine Church dwelling in the Dolmenwood region are trained within these halls.
locations.interior: Bustling common rooms, hushed hallways, contemplative courtyards.
locations.exterior: A 4-storeyed edifice decorated with grimacing gargoyles of dark stone
locations.populace: Abbot Hargle, Sanctus Primus, 100 monastics and priests in training, 15 clerics of the Order of St Faxis, a dozen librarians

services.name: Sage consultation
services.description: Research into matters of Church lore
services.cost: standard sage rates or free for Church servants

services.name: Lodging
services.description: Simple monastic lodgings and food for Church servants

secrets: Texts of questionable nature hidden in locked crypt vaults
Secret gaols and interrogation chambers for political prisoners, Drunes, and witches

locations.name: Ducal Barracks
locations.description: A long, low building of heavy stone with many small windows. Home to the castle garrison.
locations.interior: Spartan mess halls, plush officers' studies and smoking rooms, stark bunk rooms.
locations.exterior: A long, low building of heavy stone with many small windows
locations.populace: Captain Bogle (commander of the garrison), 80 soldiers, a dozen staff

locations.name: Tourney Grounds
locations.description: The paved inner courtyard of the castle, used as a practice grounds for the duke's soldiery and knights.
locations.exterior: Paved inner courtyard
locations.populace: Duke's soldiery and knights

locations.name: Clod's Stair and the Headless Gate
locations.description: A wide stair climbs the steep northern slope of Clod's Seat, ascending from the streets of the Inner City to the castle itself. At the summit, the castle gate is flanked by two huge (30′ tall) statues of warrior kings. Both are headless.
locations.exterior: Wide stair with headless statues flanking the gate
locations.populace: 2d6+6 ducal guards stationed at any given time
special_features: Two 30' tall headless statues of warrior kings

locations.name: Cathedral of St Signis
locations.description: The centre of worship in the city, the great cathedral of St Signis rivals the Ducal Keep in height and grandeur. The cathedral's exterior is a masterwork of architecture, bristling with gargoyles and flying buttresses.
locations.interior: An echoing nave of breathtaking height and architectural ingenuity, supported by pillars and ribs resembling the trunks and limbs of trees. Candle holders and censers of pure gold. A 20′ marble statue of St Signis standing cloaked behind the altar. A profusion of side-chapels dedicated to other saints.
locations.exterior: A masterwork of architecture, bristling with gargoyles and flying buttresses
locations.populace: Weeping supplicants, silent priests

services.name: Prayer blessing
services.description: Characters praying may receive the blessing of St Signis: the ability to cast Silence

locations.name: Square of the Eidolon
locations.description: A wide, brick-paved square with a great iron statue at the centre. It depicts a looming phantom dressed in rags (known as the Eidolon), harried by two (much smaller) winged angels with swords.
locations.exterior: Wide, brick-paved square with great iron statue
locations.populace: General public
special_features: Great iron statue of the Eidolon with mysterious runes
secrets: The statue's origin is unknown and its runes cannot be deciphered even by magic

locations.name: The Silent Gate
locations.description: The Inner City's south gate is flanked on each side by a statue of an angel with a finger raised to its lips in a gesture of silence.
locations.exterior: Gate flanked by angel statues gesturing silence
locations.populace: 2d6 soldiers of the city watch at any given time

locations.name: Grand Market
locations.description: The city's most luxurious markets take place daily in this cobblestoned square. Specialist merchants of different kinds are present on each particular day of the week.
locations.exterior: Cobblestoned square
locations.populace: Specialist merchants, 1d6 soldiers of the city watch

services.name: Colly markets
services.description: Hounds, trained beasts, and rare animals

services.name: Moot markets
services.description: Gastronomic specialities from far and wide

special_features: Different specialist merchants each day of the week

locations.name: The Chateau
locations.description: A grandiose, 4-storey inn with a black wooden frame and painted wooden panels in the style of a rustic manor house. The Chateau is known as the city's second finest inn—despite the continued efforts of the proprietors, its reputation is one of affected luxury, rather than the true class of its rival, The Bitter Rose.
locations.interior: Private, waited rooms. A small auditorium music room with deep carmine wallpaper and dainty chairs upholstered in floral silk.
locations.exterior: Grandiose, 4-storey inn with black wooden frame and painted wooden panels
locations.populace: Flashy merchants, wealthy dilettantes, upcoming musicians and singers, foppish minor nobles and their fawning entourages
special_features: No public bar or common room

locations.name: The Maw
locations.description: The Inner City's west gate is shaped like the gaping mouth of a dragon-like monster.
locations.exterior: Gate shaped like a dragon's gaping mouth
locations.populace: 2d6 soldiers of the city watch at any given time

locations.name: The Shadow House
locations.description: Home to the city's only commercially-minded guild of magicians, whose services are available for hire, to the wealthy. The Shadow House appears to be an amalgamation of random parts of several smaller buildings of clashing styles. One side features a great astrological clock.
locations.interior: A bewildering maze of wood-panelled corridors, dingy libraries, magical laboratories, and oddly-dimensioned conference rooms. The Shadow House is certainly larger inside than it seems from the outside.
locations.exterior: Amalgamation of random parts of several smaller buildings of clashing styles with a great astrological clock
locations.populace: Half a dozen guildmembers, Lady Periwinkle

services.name: Detect magic
services.description: Detection of magic on an item
services.notes: takes 1d4 days, item must be left at the House

services.name: Permanent enchantments
services.description: Permanent magicks of warding and detection
services.cost: 100gp consultation fee, actual magic begins at 500gp

secrets: Lady Periwinkle dwells in a sub-dimensional manor accessible from the cellars

locations.name: The Bitter Rose
locations.description: Once the home of a minor noble, this old-fashioned wooden manor now acts as the city's fanciest inn.
locations.interior: The manor's former feasting hall, now furnished with discreetly spaced tables, candles, silver cutlery, and leather-upholstered seating. Musicians play tastefully subdued tunes from a balcony. Private dining rooms converted from studies and smoking rooms.
locations.exterior: Old-fashioned wooden manor
locations.populace: Rich merchants and minor nobles, accompanied by a smattering of bodyguards

services.name: Rare wines
services.description: One of the finest wine cellars in the duchy
services.notes: always has all wines listed in DPB in stock

services.name: The ducal suite
services.notes: may require 100gp in palm greasing to book directly

secrets: Secret passage to The Frolicke via wine cellar

locations.name: Royal Institute of Physicks and Sorcerers
locations.description: An imposing, ecclesiastical-looking building of dark stone with a red tiled roof and two pointy towers. This is the farthest flung outpost of a magicians' guild of some influence in the wider kingdom beyond Dolmenwood—the pompously titled Royal Institute of Physicks and Sorcerers. The institute has the honour of being the only magic guild officially sanctioned by the nobility.
locations.interior: Chilly flagstoned passages, sprawling libraries, cosy studies warmed by enchanted purple flames, secluded alchemical laboratories. A profusion of odd statues lurks in nooks and corners and upon high plinths.
locations.exterior: Imposing, ecclesiastical-looking building of dark stone with red tiled roof and two pointy towers
locations.populace: Four lecturers (including Professor Edwynne Woglemain), a dozen apprentices, and a handful of servants
secrets: A demon is currently trapped in the Heptagrammic Vault
Forbidden magicks of summoning and dimensional travel are explored

locations.name: Fool's Row
locations.description: Following King's Highway into Castle Brackenwold and through the Sunken Gate, one comes to a breezy plaza known colloquially as Fool's Row.
locations.exterior: Breezy plaza lined with heroic statues
locations.populace: Jugglers, fire-breathers, sword-eaters, animal tamers, conjurers, 1d6 soldiers of the city watch
special_features: Heroic statues including Sir Windlass and Sir Chyde

locations.name: The Sunken Gate
locations.description: The east gate to the Inner City is (due to a long-forgotten quirk of planning) located beneath the wall. A stairway descends 20′ on either side of the wall, leading to a broad tunnel with the portcullised gate at its middle.
locations.exterior: Stairways descending 20' on either side of the wall
locations.populace: 2d6 soldiers of the city watch at any given time

locations.name: Well Gardens
locations.description: Fancy public gardens, where well-to-do couples stroll on sunny days and love-struck poets compose odes.
locations.exterior: Fancy public gardens with wishing well and swan fountain
locations.populace: Well-to-do couples, poets, 1d3 soldiers of the city watch
special_features: Wishing well with coins at bottom
Extravagant tiered marble fountain with swan heads

locations.name: The Frolicke
locations.description: The slopes of Clod's Seat are devoted to scrupulously cultivated woods and gardens where nobles come to frolic and pontificate. The woods can only be accessed from within the castle; there is no public entry from the Inner City.
locations.exterior: Scrupulously cultivated woods and gardens on the slopes of Clod's Seat
locations.populace: Nobles, 2d4 ducal guards
special_features: Bronze statue of howling Duchess Phespherine
Secret passage to the Bitter Rose
secrets: Hidden trapdoor at foot of merman statue leads to secret passage
Duchess Phespherine's spirit haunts the woods

locations.name: Herb Gardens
locations.description: Neat rows of medicinal herbs, fastidiously maintained by the monks of the Seminary of 100 Martyrs.
locations.exterior: Neat rows of medicinal herbs with old yew tree at center
locations.populace: Monks from the Seminary, Mistress Waldefroum
special_features: St Wort's tree - dilapidated old yew tree

locations.name: The Poppy Cock
locations.description: A dishevelled building of tarred planks with a huge weather-cock on the point of its roof. The Poppy Cock is an infamous den of gamblers, smugglers, cutpurses, and harlots.
locations.interior: A winding, low-roofed room, narrowing almost to a corridor in places, packed with rickety stools. The place reeks with the bonfire aroma of Burglar's Blend pipeleaf. Gloomy side-rooms for gambling.
locations.exterior: Dishevelled building of tarred planks with huge weather-cock
locations.populace: Thieves, thugs, mercenaries, gamblers, smugglers, cutpurses, harlots

services.name: Pipeleaf
services.notes: purchased from pedlars in common room

secrets: Thieves' guild meeting place with code phrases and gestures

npcs.name: Captain Merriman Bogle
npcs.title: Commander of the Garrison
npcs.description: A red-cheeked, white-whiskered human man in his middle years, never seen without his pipe in his teeth
npcs.speech: Staccato, rife with military metaphor. Woldish.
desires: Word on the whereabouts of his eldest son, Jocund, who disappeared in the vicinity of Prigwort while hunting
A landed title—has his eye on Malbleat's manse, Redwraith Manor (hex 0709)
npcs.occupation: Level 10 Fighter, Commander of the Garrison

known_topics.content: Bogle twirls his moustache proudly. 'Eighty soldiers under my command. The castle defenses are impenetrable—a military marvel!'
His face darkens. 'My eldest son, Jocund... disappeared near Prigwort while hunting. Any word of his whereabouts would be... generously rewarded.'
He gazes wistfully. 'Malbleat's manse, Redwraith Manor... a man like myself deserves a proper estate, wouldn't you say?'

triggers.npc_response: Servants of the Duke! Welcome, friends!

npcs.name: Drouge Underhill
npcs.title: The Chateau Proprietor
npcs.description: A human man resisting his advancing years, his balding pate topped with a modish wig, his cheek adorned with a beauty mark, and his moustache fashionably curled
npcs.dress: Modish wig, beauty mark, fashionably curled moustache
desires: To eclipse the Bitter Rose as the town's finest inn
The hand of Lady Haeroth in marriage

known_topics.content: Drouge fawns rapidly. 'The Chateau offers the finest lodgings in the city! Our music room hosts exquisite performances—far superior to certain other establishments.'
He sniffs disdainfully. 'The Bitter Rose? Overrated! The Chateau will eclipse them soon enough. True refinement is what we offer.'

npcs.name: Lady Periwinkle
npcs.title: Guildmistress of the Shadow House
npcs.description: A wan, wide-eyed human woman apparently in her 20s, dressed in elegant courtly gowns and adorned with a profusion of pearls. Her delicate, perfectly formed visage and lustrous silver locks enchant those who look upon her
npcs.dress: Elegant courtly gowns adorned with a profusion of pearls
npcs.speech: Demure yet firm. Woldish, Old Woldish, Sylvan.
desires: The affections of Lady Zoemina, the duke's 22-year-old daughter
secrets: In truth, Lady Periwinkle is in her middle-age, using a Mirror of Youthfulness

known_topics.content: Lady Periwinkle's gaze drifts distantly. 'Detection of magic, permanent enchantments... the Shadow House serves those who can afford true sorcery.'
Her eyes flash with sudden wit. 'Do you know of Ygraine? The Lady of Thorns holds secrets I would dearly love to uncover.'

secret_info.content: Lady Periwinkle is actually in her middle age. She uses a Mirror of Youthfulness to maintain her youthful appearance.
secret_info.hint: She occasionally seems to avoid mirrors and reflective surfaces when others are watching.

secret_info.content: Lady Periwinkle desires the affections of Lady Zoemina, the Duke's 22-year-old daughter.
secret_info.hint: She speaks of the ducal family with unusual interest, particularly the daughter.

npcs.name: Hadle Butterwheeve
npcs.title: Bitter Rose Butler
npcs.description: A portly human man in his late forties, with prodigious mutton chops, beady eyes, and a petulantly protruding lower lip. His tailored black attire is the picture of tasteful modesty. His only indulgence is his fastidiously preened hair
npcs.dress: Tailored black attire, fastidiously preened hair
desires: To expand his collection of taxidermied trottelings
Privately wishes to know more about his enigmatic employers
secrets: Knows about the secret passage to The Frolicke but not where it leads

known_topics.content: Hadle bows slowly. 'The Bitter Rose offers accommodations of the finest quality. Our wine cellar is unmatched in the duchy.'
His eyes light up subtly. 'Taxidermied trottelings... I collect them, you see. Should you encounter any specimens...'

secret_info.content: Hadle knows about a secret passage in the wine cellar that leads somewhere, but he doesn't know where it goes—to The Frolicke.
secret_info.hint: He occasionally glances toward the wine cellar with a curious, guarded expression.

npcs.name: Professor Edwynne Woglemain
npcs.title: Divination Master and Head of College
npcs.description: An ambitious, scheming human man in his fifties, dressed in purple felt, with a white beard to his belly. His beak-like nose and intensely peering eyes lend him a hawkish air. Wears half-moon spectacles
demeanor: only wishes to speak with those of great intellect
npcs.speech: Precise and succinct. Woldish, Old Woldish, Sylvan, Caprice, a smattering of otherworldly tongues.
desires: To convince the duke that the rumours of black magic conducted at the institute are untrue
To enlist the aid of his former colleague, Madame Thornwaife in constructing demon-binding chains

known_topics.content: Woglemain peers intensely. 'The Royal Institute of Physicks and Sorcerers is the only magic guild sanctioned by nobility. We do not serve the common rabble.'
His eyes gleam with obsession. 'Other worlds, dimensional travel... do you possess any knowledge of such matters? I pay handsomely for genuine information.'
He muses coldly. 'My former colleague, Madame Thornwaife... I require her expertise in constructing demon-binding chains. If you know of her whereabouts...'

secret_info.content: A demon is currently trapped in the Heptagrammic Vault within the Institute. Forbidden magicks of summoning are explored here.
secret_info.hint: Strange sounds and lights occasionally emanate from the lower levels of the Institute.

npcs.name: One-Eyed Gil
npcs.title: Poppy Cock Landlady
npcs.description: A wiry-framed human woman in her late thirties, with cropped black hair, a dozen earrings, and both eyes intact. (She and the regulars mockingly refuse to explain the origin of her nickname.) Her arms are adorned with tattoos of burly breggles
npcs.dress: Cropped black hair, dozen earrings, tattoos of burly breggles
desires: Information on the layout of the Ducal Keep and any weaknesses in its defences
To insinuate herself deeper into the trust of Sanctus Primus and subtly elicit secrets
To become mistress of the thieves' guild
secrets: Has a clandestine relationship with Sanctus Primus
Is a member of the thieves' guild

known_topics.content: Gil snarls loudly. 'Lodging, food, pipeleaf—we've got it all. Don't expect fancy here. This is a place for real folk.'
She feigns drunkenness but her eyes are sharp. 'Looking for work? The kind that doesn't ask too many questions? You might be in the right place.'

secret_info.content: Gil has a clandestine relationship with Sanctus Primus of the Seminary. She uses this to elicit secrets about Church activities.
secret_info.hint: She occasionally shows surprising knowledge of Seminary affairs.

secret_info.content: Gil desperately seeks information on the layout of the Ducal Keep and any weaknesses in its defenses—for a future heist.
secret_info.hint: She asks subtle questions about the castle whenever nobles or guards visit.

npcs.name: Mistress Hanctra Waldefroum
npcs.title: Seminary Herbalist
npcs.description: An elderly human woman with a wobbly pot-belly and eyes like merrily gleaming jewels. Walks with a stick
npcs.mannerisms: Benevolent smile. Rubs her sore knees and back
npcs.speech: Wavering, meandering, filled with reminiscences. Grumbles good-naturedly about her back pains. Woldish, Liturgic, Old Woldish.
desires: Rare herb and fungus varieties (willing to purchase with Church funds)

known_topics.content: Mistress Waldefroum smiles benevolently. 'These gardens have been tended by the Seminary for generations. Medicinal herbs of all kinds—I know them all.'
Her eyes gleam like jewels. 'Rare herbs, unusual fungi... the Church has funds for such specimens. Bring them to me, and you shall be compensated.'

triggers.npc_response: Fellow servants of the faith! How may I help you?

entries.description: 1d4 longhorns and 3d6 shorthorns—emissaries of Lord Ramius sent to the duke
A pickpocket charging through the streets, 2d4 soldiers of the town watch pursuing
20 musicians and carts laden with fancy, orchestral instruments, heading to the Chateau
A grimalkin pedlar laden with herbs to sell to Mistress Waldefroum
12 pilgrims on their way to the Cathedral of St Signis
Captain Bogle and 2d6 nobles returning from the hunt with several stag heads
2d4 clerics of St Faxis carrying a cloaked man (allegedly a Drune) in silver chains to the holy gaol in the Seminary of the 100 Martyrs
A troupe of jugglers, fire breathers, and thespians performing in a public square. Pickpockets are rife
2d4 thieves sneaking to the Frolicke, seeking a secret passage beneath a merman statue
A young woman with a curious glint in her eyes (charmed) bearing a report from the Drune to Bishop Sanguine on the doings of the Cold Prince
An adventuring party bringing a bound fire elemental to Professor Woglemain
2d4 soldiers of the town watch questioning passersby
